meanings.definition: A word or phrase used to describe or identify something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher explained the new scientific term to the students.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't understand the term the doctor used to explain the illness.
meanings.sent3: The term 'giant baby' made everyone laugh during the comedy show.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a term of happiness that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The term 'flying carpet' painted a vivid picture in my mind.

meanings.definition: A fixed or limited period of time during which something occurs.
meanings.sent1: The school year is divided into terms with breaks in between.
meanings.sent2: She will be studying abroad for a term to learn a new language.
meanings.sent3: During the term of the play, the actors delivered a stellar performance.
meanings.sent4: The term of the storm brought heavy rain and strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The term of the contract lasted for three years.

meanings.definition: A condition or stipulation in an agreement or contract.
meanings.sent1: The legal team reviewed every term of the contract before signing.
meanings.sent2: One important term of the agreement was the confidentiality clause.
meanings.sent3: The unusual term in the contract raised some eyebrows among the partners.
meanings.sent4: She considered the honesty term in their relationship to be crucial.
meanings.sent5: The term about punctuality was emphasized in the employee handbook.
